channel.title: Recent blog posts featured by QuantStack team
channel.description: RSS feed for QuantStack website blog page

item.title: Instantly view Parquet files in JupyterLab with Arbalister
item.description: Arbalister is a JupyterLab extension that enables seamless viewing of many tabular file formats, including Parquet, CSV, Avro, ORC, and SQLite.
item.dc:creator: Antoine Prouvost

item.title: Introducing notebook.link: The Future of Notebook Sharing
item.description: We are excited to unveil notebook.link, a groundbreaking platform that simplifies sharing and running notebooks like never before.
item.dc:creator: QuantStack

item.title: JupyterLite 0.7 is released! ðŸŽ‰
item.description: The new 0.7 release includes a number of new features, bug fixes, and enhancements. This release also brings significant improvements to the user experience and new customization options for JupyterLite deployments.
item.dc:creator: Jeremy Tuloup

item.title: Teaching a Billion People to Code: How JupyterLite Is Scaling the Impossible
item.description: QuantStack, an â€œalmost accidental startup,â€ is building a serverless distro of JupyterLab for Jupyterâ€™s global adoption.
item.dc:creator: Michelle Gienow

item.title: JupyterLab 4.5 and Notebook 7.5 are available!
item.description: JupyterLab 4.5 has been released! This new minor release of JupyterLab includes 51 new features and enhancements, 81 bug fixes, 44 maintenance tasks and 38 documentation improvements.
item.dc:creator: Jeremy Tuloup

item.title: GNU Octave Meets JupyterLite: Compute Anywhere, Anytime!
item.description: We are thrilled to announce the newest member of our JupyterLite kernel ecosystem: Xeus-Octave. Xeus-Octave allows you to run GNU Octave code directly on your browser.
item.dc:creator: Isabel Paredes

item.title: JupyterGIS breaks through to the next level
item.description: Launched in June 2024, JupyterGIS was introduced as a collaborative, web-based GIS environment built on the JupyterLab framework. Its objective is to bring QGIS-inspired workflows into the browserâ€¦
item.dc:creator: Martin Renou, Arjun Verma, Gregory Mooney, Sylvain Corlay

item.title: Sovereign Tech Agency Invests in Apache Arrowâ€™s Future with QuantStack
item.description: We are thrilled to announce that the Sovereign Tech Fund is providing critical funding to sustain and improve Apache Arrow, an essential open-source project in the modern data ecosystem.
item.dc:creator: Antoine Pitrou, RaÃºl Cumplido

item.title: From Linux Parties to Global Impact: An Interview with Sylvain Corlay, Founder of QuantStack
item.description: In todayâ€™s article, we had the chance to speak with Sylvain Corlay, long-time contributor of the Jupyter project, used by millions of people worldwide, and CEO-founder of QuantStack, an open-source development company employing around thirty people.
item.dc:creator: Sylvain Corlay, Arthur Vervaet

item.title: A Year in Review: QuantStackâ€™s Contributions to Apache Arrow
item.description: Since November 2024, QuantStack has been involved in the maintenance and development of Apache Arrow. We have a team of several engineers workingâ€¦
item.dc:creator: Antoine Pitrou, RaÃºl Cumplido

item.title: Create your own layers in JupyterGIS
item.description: JupyterGIS-tiler is a JupyterGIS extension that lets you use a notebook to process your (Xarray) data and make it available as raster tiles, so that it can be visualized in JupyterGIS.
item.dc:creator: David Brochart

item.title: C++ in Jupyter â€” Interpreting C++ in the Web
item.description: Scientists and engineers utilize programming languages not only to build software systems but also to drive interactive exploratory workflows. They leverage developer tools to explore and reason through problems effectively.
item.dc:creator: Anutosh Bhat, Vassil Vassilev

item.title: JupyterLite 0.6.0 is released! ðŸŽ‰
item.description: The new 0.6.0 release includes a number of new features, bug fixes, and enhancements. This release also brings significant improvements to the user experience and new customization options for JupyterLite deployments.
item.dc:creator: Jeremy Tuloup

item.title: JupyterLab 4.4 and Notebook 7.4 are available!
item.description: JupyterLab 4.4 has been released! This new minor release of JupyterLab includes 28 new features and enhancements, 76 bug fixes, 63 maintenance tasks and 34 documentation improvements.
item.dc:creator: Jeremy Tuloup

item.title: Congratulations, Distinguished Contributors!
item.description: We are proud to announce the recipients of the Jupyter Distinguished Contributor (JDC) award for the 2024 cohort of contributors.
item.dc:creator: Johan Mabille

item.title: Making Qt collaborative using CRDTs
item.description: A journal on creating a collaborative application with Qt
item.dc:creator: David Brochart

item.title: R in the Browser: Announcing Our WebAssembly Distribution
item.description: R is now available in emscripten-forge, enabling the Xeus-R kernel in JupyterLite.
item.dc:creator: Isabel Paredes

item.title: Real-time collaboration and collaborative editing for GIS workflows with Jupyter and QGIS
item.description: We are excited to announce JupyterGIS, a web-based, collaborative, and extensible interface for GIS, leveraging the JupyterLab application framework and integrating seamlessly with the Jupyter notebook interface.
item.dc:creator: Meriem Ben Ismail, Nicolas Brichet, David Brochart, Matt Fisher, Anne Fouilloux, Greg Mooney, Martin Renou, Arjun Verma

item.title: PyData Paris 2025 Keynotes
item.description: We are thrilled to announce the keynote speakers for the upcoming PyData Paris 2025, the leading gathering of the open-source data science and AI/ML community in France.
item.dc:creator: Sandrine Pataut

item.title: Announcing JupyterCAD 3.0
item.description: We are thrilled to introduce JupyterCAD 3.0, the newest version of the collaborative CAD modeler designed for JupyterLab.
item.dc:creator: Arjun Verma, Trung Le, Martin Renou
